intro: Neuroloma arabidiflorum, commonly known as the desert orchid, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the Middle East and North Africa. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, often fragrant blossoms. The plant has adapted to harsh environments with thick, waxy leaves that reduce water loss. Its roots are specialized to store moisture, allowing it to survive prolonged droughts. Despite its beauty, it is rare and faces threats from habitat destruction and climate change.
